contextId.information: The author uses a question to emphasize that God has never said this to an angel. AT: "But God has never said to an angel at any time ... feet.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: But to which of the angels has God said at any time ... feet"?

contextId.information: The author uses a question to emphasize that the people will certainly receive punishment if they refuse God's salvation through Christ. AT: "then God will certainly punish us if we do not pay attention to his message about how God will save us!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: how then can we escape if we ignore so great a salvation?

contextId.information: The author uses questions to teach his readers. These two questions can be joined as one statement, if needed. AT: "All those who came out of Egypt with Moses heard God, yet they still rebelled." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Who was it who heard God and rebelled? Was it not all those who came out of Egypt through Moses?

contextId.information: The author uses this question to teach his readers. AT: "And it was to those who disobeyed that he swore that he would not let them enter his rest." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: To whom did he swear that they would not enter his rest, if it was not to those who disobeyed him?

contextId.information: This question emphasizes that it was unexpected that priests come after the order of Melchizedek. AT: "no one would have needed another priest, one who was like Melchizedek and not like Aaron, to arise." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: what further need would there have been for another priest to arise after the manner of Melchizedek, and not be considered to be after the manner of Aaron?

contextId.information: The author uses this question to emphasize that Christ's sacrifice was the most powerful. AT: "then certainly Christ's blood will cleanse our conscience even more from dead works to serve the living God! Because, through the eternal Spirit, he offered himself without blemish to God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: how much more will the blood of Christ ... cleanse our conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

contextId.information: The author uses a question to state that the sacrifices were limited in their power. This can be stated in active form. AT: "they would have ceased offering those sacrifices." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: would not those sacrifices have ceased to be offered?

contextId.information: The author is emphasizing the greatness of the punishment for those who reject Christ. AT: "This was severe punishment. But the punishment will be even greater for anyone ... grace!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: How much worse punishment do you think one deserves ... grace?

contextId.information: The author makes the point throught this question that every good father disciplines his children. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "every father disciplines his children!" (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: what son is there whom his father does not discipline?

contextId.information: The author uses a question to emphasize that would should obey God the Father. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "Therefore we should even more so obey the Father of spirits and live!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Should we not even more so obey the Father of spirits and live?
